required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multiple Ascending Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability of DC371739 Treatment in Hypercholesterolemic
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Phase Ib/IIa Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of DC739 Multiple-Dose in Hypercholesterolemic Subjects.

collaborator.agency: The First Hospital of Jilin University

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to evaluate safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of DC739 after multiple-dose oral administration, to explore the clinical effective dose, and to initially explore the efficacy and safety in hypercholesterolemia subjects.

detailed_description.textblock:
Totally about 30-50 qualified subjects were assigned to one of the following dose groups：20mg, 40mg, 60mg, 80mg, 120 mg (60mg and 120mg is the optional dose group). Each of the dose groups will include 10 subjects (8 for DC739 and 2 for placebo).
Subjects will be admitted for treatment on day -1 and receive the first dose of study drug or placebo on day 1 and then treat for 28 days. Subjects from different dose groups were enrolled in turn, the next dose group is conducted on the premise that the D15 safety evaluation was completed after the administration of the previous dose group with the result was tolerance.
Blood samples will be collected on day 1 for 48 hours and day 28 for 72 hours after administration for pharmacokinetic data analysis. Blood lipid will be collected for effectiveness evaluation. PCSK9 and ANGPTL3, Urine and feces were collected for explore analysis.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants are assigned to one of 5 groups in parallel for the duration of the study

arm_group.description: Orally administered DC371739 tablets QD afer meal

intervention.description: Participants received one of 5 dose levels of DC371739 administered as single oral doses.

facility.name: The First Hospital of Jilin University
